data.meta_site_name: Wright Funeral Home and Cremation Service
data.text: Mary E. Leach, age 91, of Glyndon, MN, died Sunday, September 5, 2010, in Golden Living Center, Moorhead, MN.Mary Elizabeth Holler was born on May 5, 1919, to Peter and Amelia Rheinhart Holler in Argusville, ND. She grew up and attended school in Argusville. On December 5, 1938, she married Earl Leach in Moorhead, MN. Together they had four children. Mary and Earl farmed in rural Glyndon until their retirement. Mary also worked as a cook at the Highway Host for many years. She became a resident of Golden Living Center in June, 2007, where she has resided since. Mary enjoyed cooking, crocheting, knitting and spending time at the lake. She is survived by three sons, Gary Leach, Virgil Deborah Leach and Charles Rita Leach all of Glyndon, MN; one daughter, Shirley Wesley Berg of Abercrombie, ND; step-son, Verle Marge Leach of Moorhead, MN; eighteen grandchildren, and twenty nine great-grandchildren.She was preceded in death by her parents, her husband, Earl, six brothers, George, John, Dennis, Elmer, Walter and Robert Holler, three sisters, Tillie Higgins, Emma Leu and Lucille Sandal; step-daughter, Bethel Brunelle; daughter-in-law, Karen Leach, one grandchild and two great-grandchildren.
